description.narrative: Support towards Implementing Zimbabwe's Nationally Determined Contributions under the Paris Agreement on Climate Change

activity-description.narrative: This project is a nation wide project reaching the population of Zimbabwe
This project is being implemented nation wide

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative:
1. LEDS and framework launched by 2019 2. MRV for GHG emissions in at least 3 Industries by 2019
3. MRV team data collection and reporting is more accurate and systematic, advanced IPCC methodologies are applied, data collection system is functional and well-organized by 2019 4. At least 1 partnership engagement with a Russian Private sector company or training institution by 20205.
5. At least 1 policy that supports low emission pathways approved

comment.narrative:
No cross-sector strategy for low emission development LEDS and NDC action and investment programme.
Several gaps have been identified in the current MRV system as part of work to produce the 3rd communications. Lack of records and poor record keeping systems at company level has also contributed to data gaps.
Limited public, private investments and public-private-academic expertise in low emission development. direct investments and other capital inflows. This has contributed to a piecemeal mitigation response. No renewable Energy policy

1.1. Finalised roadmap for crafting LEDS and Consultations with relevant private sec-tor and government stakeholders pro-duce a set of recommendations for LE development 1.2. Finalised GHG emission trends and mit-igation scenario analysis
1.3. First draft of LEDS document crafted - based on stake-holder consultations and sector mitiga-tion scenario analyses 1.4. UNFCCC NDC rec-ommendations for LEDS development are incorporated in first draft for LEDS
2.1. MRV needs identi-fied and prioritized per sector, in-formed by needs assessment exercise 2.2. Improved data col-lection and analysis MRV capacity among participants 2.3. NDC and MRV in-formation materi-als developed and disseminated; in-formed by needs assessment 2.4. Forestry sector MRV reports produced 2.5Study on Forestry Emission Reference Levels con-ducted 2.6. RE GIS mappings and MRV reports produced 2.7. Increased aware-ness and interest among academics on LEDS and MRV 2.8. Policy brief on LEDS and NDC developed and shared with key high level and technical level stakeholders. Feedback meeting report produced.
3.1. Potential partners in Russia are identified 3.2. Forestry GCF concept note and prefeasibility study submitted to GCF by May 2018 3.3. GoZ officials have improved understanding of GCF processes and require-ments. A first draft of a final proposal and feasibility study is produced by October 2018. 3.4. Roadmap for es-tablishing Zimba-bwe National Climate Fund de-veloped

1.1. Roadmap for crafting LEDS in place and recommendations for LE development secured from pvt sector and gvt stakeholders 1.2.GHG emission trends and mitigation scenario analysis completed with data gaps identified in the forestry sector
1.3.Sector mitigation scenario analyses focus on 4 industries initiated into 2019 1.4. UNFCCC NDC recommendations for LEDS development secured and now incorporated in first draft for LEDS roadmap
2.1. MRV needs identified and prioritized in three sectors 2.2. 17 experts' MRV capacity among for three sectors 2.3. 4 NDC and MRV information materials developed and disseminated; 2.4. Forestry sector MRV reports produced 2.5 Study on Forestry Emission Reference Levels replaced by the study on sources of deforestation owing to data gaps 2.6. RE GIS mappings and MRV reports produced 2.7.2 academic institutions engaged and awareness and interest among academics on LEDS and MRV raised significantly 2.8. 1 high-level stakeholder platform revived and briefed on LEDS and NDC developed
3.1. Initial dialogue with Russian Embassy to identify potential partners started UNDP will take advantage of the Russia Funded UNV position in the CO 3.2. Forestry GCF concept note and pre-feasibility study was not submitted to GCF by May 2018 as planned - more partnership engagements needed remains a prerequisite 3.3. 2 GoZ officials exposed to GCF processes and requirements though online and one on one training 3.4.The country achieved advanced the national discussions around how to establish a climate finance facility to support investments into Low Emission Development through exchange with the Rwandan FONERWA fund. still in the initial stages

1.1. LEDS validated, finalised and launched 1.2. MRV system guidance draft annexed to the LEDS strategy
1.3. Engage and exposed Ministry of Finance officials on Climate Change and LEDS to influence Economic Development Plan and Budgeting
2.1. Complete Study on drivers of deforestation study and forest definition 2.2. Support capacity of Forestry Commission on measurements for forest carbon 2.3. Support strategic capacity of targeted sectors (4 sectors) Agriculture, Forestry and Land Use IPCC in IPCC methodologies 2.4. Support the capacity of Ministry of Energy and Power Development in RE GIS mapping
3.1. Climate Finance Facility dialogue in collaboration with FONERWA, IDBZ, WB and GVt towards a National CCF Facility 3.2. Facilitate learning exchange with Russian Private sector and Tertiary Institutions for GVt. and private sector

1.1. LEDS final draft delivered and high degree of ownership exhibited. Being edited 1.2. Final draft MRV system guidance delivered to accompany LEDS
1.3. Ministry of Finance exposed on Climate Change and LEDS to influence Economic Development Plan and Budgeting
2.1. Drivers of deforestation study completed and forest definition drafts delivered. 2.2. Forest sector data collection equipment delivered to facilitate measurements for forest carbon 2.3. 4 sectors Agriculture, Forestry and Land Use IPCC stakeholders capacityon IPCC methodologies and have commenced more detailed data collection 2.4. Ministry of Energy and Power Development RE GIS mapping work conducted.
3.1. IDBZ Climate Finance Feasibility inception report delivered. Collaboration with WB setup for complementary support on experiences onf CFFs from the region . 3.2. learning visit dates - November

Exchange Learning trip to Russia on Low Emission Strategy LEDS Launch
Climate Investment Forum and Case Study NDC Revision

Exchange Learning trip to Russia on Low Emission Strategy postponed due to COVID19 LEDS has been finalized and the Launch postponed due to COVID-19 and new date to be set
Climate Investment Forum postponed due to COVID-19 and new date to be set and preparations for the Climate Investment Case Study are underway Work to build on NDC Revision ongoing

1. Launch of LEDS 2. Launch of Climate Change Learning Strategy
3. Launch and submission of revised NDC 4. Completed Green Jobs Assessment (Just Transition)
5. Completed Energy Efficiency Policy 6. Completed Solar thermal bankable proposal development 7. Finalized IDBZ Climate Change facility.

1. Finalized, Launch and printed of LEDS and related policy briefs 2. Climate Change Learning Strategy successfully launched and priority activities implemented
3. Zimbabwe NDCs revised, launched and submitted to UNFCCC 4. The Green Jobs Assessment (Just Transition) completed and inform NDC revision process
5. Energy Efficiency Policy completed and implementation start 6. Solar thermal bankable proposal developed and fundraising is launched 7. The IDBZ Climate Change facility is fully set up and operationalized and fundraising launched
